page.title: 11FARMING IN DRIFFIELD
page.content: There are now three farmers who farm land which forms part of the parish of Driffield. They are Mr. Robert Henly, Mr. John Swettenham, and Mr. John Ford. Mr. Bruce Hamilton, who is Mr.Henly's farm manager told us about the crops grown on the farm. The winter wheat is harvested in July and the winter barley in August. Evening Primrose is one of the other crops that are grown, and it is used for medical purpses such as the relief of arhritis. Mr. Henly has 6 workers who work for him on the farm. He has about 800 sheep of the Colbred breed. The farm machinery comprises one combine harvester, one sprayer,and six tractors. Mr. Henly farms about 800 acres, and Mr. Swettenham about 100 acres.
